content.description: Sport climb which features the first 2 bolts of bouldery moves (11b). Three (3) more bolts which leave the right side of a large hueco take one over a bulgey area of steadily increasing difficulty and abrasiveness. The severity wanes from the 5th to the top especially if one bears right.
content.protection: 5 bolts total. The consenses among others is that another bolt just above the 2nd would have been more enjoyable and would result in an additional star. Both getting to the 4th bolt and sucessfully clipping it is a challenge.
content.location: The 2nd from the rightmost route on this the main Yakov Wall (two more sport routes lie 100' north on a separate formation). This route also shares the anchor with the route just to its left (Descent of the Fire Ants).

content.description: Bolted face climb. The rock is sharp on this wall, this route is no exception. Crux is at bolt 2. Climbing over the bulge near the top is fun too.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor. This route shares an anchor with "The Fixer", which is the next bolted route to the right.

content.description: Excellent pockets and edges in sustained headwall above a broken crack start in white rock. Nice reinforced jug starts the crux sequence.

Stick clip the 1st bolt climbing the overhanging bulge (the crux) follow the next 3 bolts on a gradual lesser angle of rock to the slab above. The anchor is a single thickness sling with one aluminum rap ring- so either supplement it or the route can be walked off to the south along the top.
content.protection: Bolts leading to an anchor intelligently placed so as to maximize the greatest difficulty pulling ones ropes.
content.location: Left-most sport route on the wall.

content.description: This route follows the left side of the arete in the central parts of the wall and courses over a small rooflet. What's bad about this route is that it's painful- having said that though, what's good about it is it's mildly fun.
content.protection: Three (3) bolts. Recommend stick-clipping the first bolt.
content.location: Shares the anchors with The Endictment (5.9+) to its left.

content.description: This sport route follows two (2) bolts of 5.11b just to the right of a crack which is in turn to the right of the central right-facing corner on the cliff. The halfway point is reached at a small ledge, then two (2) more bolts worth of 5.11c slightly overhanging face.
content.protection: Four (4) lead bolts and a two (2) bolt anchor which might or might not have any descending hardware on them.
content.location: Centrally located to the right of a corner.

content.description: This route has a crux between bolts 1 and 2. Pretty enjoyable.
content.location: Is just to the right of Solitary Confinement (10a) and shares the anchor with it.

content.description: The crux is at the first bolt of a very fun route. Has a small rooflet near the top.
content.location: Central part of the wall and shares the anchors with the route to the right- The    Free Thinker.

content.description: Solo up 15' onto a ledge, join a dihedral that's less then 90 degrees for 3 bolts. Chimney up to the 2nd bolt and then stay on the left wall to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts lead to the same bogus anchor that Pork Junky and Bibikov Arete share as well.
content.location: The 3rd bolted sport route from the left (not including of course the single bolt anchor on the bouldering problem on the extreme left).

content.description: This route follows the first 2 bolts of its sister- Turkey Sisters at 5.11b. Three (3) more bolts take one over a rooflet w/ huecos (11c).
content.location: The left variant of Turkey Sisters.

content.description: Tricky climbing on a blunt Arete. The holds are sharp on this wall and this climb is no exception. The crux is definitely between bolts 1 and 2. Much easier climbing after bolt 3.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor (Same anchor as 'Pork Junky' to the left).

content.description: A Northeast facing wall that was one of the sites of the Phoenix bouldering contest. Most routes weigh in with 4 or 5 bolts in length and feature very rough rock.
